name: Quizzes Are Educational Fun | Mixed 20 Questions | 20 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following is a musical about a little orphan girl adopted by a rich man?
What is a line on a map connecting places of equal atmospheric pressure called?
questions.explanation:
Isobar.

	All of the answers are lines on a map connecting places of equal values. Isohel is an equal period of sunshine, isohyet is equal rainfall and isotherm is equal temperature.

questions.text: Which of the Beatles wrote the hits 'Here Comes the Sun', 'While My Guitar Gently Weeps' and 'Something'?
The Aboriginal Australians call Ayers Rock, Uluru, meaning 'Great Pebble'. What rock is it made from?
Who was known as the 'Great Stone Face' because no matter how funny he is, he never loses his trademark solemn face?
Who discovered an island in the Pacific on Easter day in 1722 and named it Easter Island?
questions.explanation:
Jacob Roggeveen.

	He was a Dutch navigator and became the first European to discover the island.

questions.text: What type of animal is a bandy-bandy?
questions.explanation:
Snake.

	It is a distinctive black and white snake from Australia.

questions.text: What are the largest group of reptiles with over 3,700 known species?
In what year, for the first time, were women competing in athletics in the Olympics having previously been limited to sports such as swimming?
Which tribes of Indians trapped and killed General Custer's forces at the battle of the Little Bighorn?
Fourteen-year-old Romanian gymnast Nadia Comaneci scored 10 out of 10 at which Olympic games?
What was the name of the dog that found the missing Football World Cup which was stolen in 1966?
questions.explanation:
Pickles.

	Pickles' owner, a London docker, saw him sniffing a bundle of newspapers which covered the famous gold trophy.

questions.text: Which of the following countries does the river Nile NOT pass through?
questions.explanation:
Zambia.

	Its 4,145 miles in length and also passes through Egypt.

questions.text: What was the name of the tall Texan who became the first black heavyweight boxing champion of the world in 1908?
What is the name of the largest mountain on the island of Martinique that means 'bald' in French?
questions.explanation:
Mount Pelee.

	Some 30,000 people were reported killed by poisonous volcanic fumes when Mount Pelee erupted in 1902.

questions.text: Who invented the bikini?
From which stone were the American President's heads made, at Mount Rushmore?
Gutzon Borglum died before the Presidents' heads at Mount Rushmore were finished but were completed by his son. Name him.
How many people died in the surprise attack on the American Pacific Fleet berthed at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii on 7th December 1941?
Which of the following countries was the last to give women the right to vote?
questions.explanation:
France.

	Australia in 1902, Russia in 1917, Poland in 1919 and France in 1944. Hope you enjoyed the quiz and learnt something new.
